amendment.description: Amendment reauthorizes the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act of 1974; provides for a new juvenile delinquency prevention block grant program; provides funds for mentoring, family strengthening programs, training and employment programs, mental health services, and other initiatives designed to prevent juvenile delinquency.
amendment.purpose: An amendment no. 36 and printed in Part A of H.Rept. 106-186 to add the provisions of H.R. 1150 to address juvenile delinquency prevention programs including after school programs, mental health services, and a flexible block grant program that can be tailored to local community requirements.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Goodling amendment (A033) Agreed to by recorded vote: 424 - 2 (Roll no. 226).
